snippet: The recent AOL controversy highlights how new 401(k) policies that use lump-sum payments can shortchange employees.
abstract: Editorial praises AOL chief executive Tim Armstrong for reversing decision to start making employer 401(k) contributions in a yearly lump sum; warns growing number of companies are adopting this pernicious cost-saving measure, which comes at the expense of working families and their increasingly insecure retirement plans.
lead_paragraph: The recent AOL controversy highlights how new 401(k) policies that use lump-sum payments can shortchange employees.
